display_asset.caption: Eldzier Cortor (1916-2015), a painter and printmaker, was part of a generation of black artists whose work was overlooked by many institutions but is now being recognized.
display_asset.credit: Produced by By DAMON WINTER, BEN LAFFIN and SOO-JEONG KANG
display_asset.title: Painting the 20th Century

summaries.body: Eldzier Cortor, a painter and printmaker, was part of a generation of black artists whose work was overlooked by many institutions but is now being recognized.
Mike Allen, Politico’s chief White House correspondent, has apologized for once offering to interview Chelsea Clinton using prearranged questions.
Dr. Jack Kevorkian’s files on assisted suicides, which include videos of patients requesting help to die, have been made public by his alma mater, the University of Michigan.

display_asset.caption: Scientists analyzed the process by watching cracks spread through a bursting balloon in slow motion.
display_asset.credit: Produced by By DAVID FRANK and JAMES GORMAN
display_asset.title: ScienceTake | How Balloons Pop

summaries.body: How your holiday balloons pop. Scientists analyzed the process by watching cracks spread through bursting balloons in slow motion.

display_asset.caption: New York Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, in April in front of the LGBT Community Center in Manhattan, will discuss the state's gains in reducing H.I.V. infections on Tuesday.

summaries.body: In a speech for World AIDS Day on Tuesday, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is expected to highlight New York's progress in its campaign to end the AIDS epidemic by 2020.

display_asset.caption: A mural in Moscow picturing “Star Wars” stormtroopers.

summaries.body: For the Walt Disney Company, movies — particularly “Star Wars: The Force Awakens” —  have been diverting investors' attention from ESPN's woes.
In Finland, ranking schools against one another is discouraged by education officials who think the practice will lead inexorably to inequality.

display_asset.caption: Rebekah Brooks leaving a London court in 2012. Ms. Brooks was acquitted of various crimes in 2014 and then basically reinstated to her old job as chief executive of News UK.

summaries.body: The unspoken laws of British tabloids have been reconfigured years after a phone-hacking scandal exposed a pattern of illicit information-gathering at The News of the World.
The Irish singer Sinead O'Connor has posted a possible suicide note on Facebook and is reported to be receiving medical attention.
Marco Rubio has run for office six times and has never lost an election, partly thanks to what a New Yorker writer suggests is his flexible political ideology.

display_asset.caption: A tribute to the album cover for Rhymefest’s “Man in the Mirror.”

summaries.body: Hello again, Rhymefest and Iron Man. Marvel will release free reprints of variant comic book covers that reinterpret hip-hop album covers with Marvel characters.
The University of Chicago has canceled all classes and activities on its main campus Monday because of a specific anonymous threat of gun violence.
The search for Queen Nefertiti’s final resting place has begun — and it’s taking place inside King Tutankhamen's tomb.
Spanish fans of "The Good, the Bad and the Ugly" are offering sponsored fake headstones to restore the movie's fictional Sad Hill cemetery before the 50th anniversary.

display_asset.caption: Members of CrossFit Boston at the gym. Some members compare the community aspect of CrossFit to that of church.
display_asset.credit: Adam Glanzman for The New York Times

summaries.body: The CrossFit gym franchise, which serves two million exercisers, has become the focus of study by researchers trying to pinpoint what constitutes religiosity in America.
Severe fuel shortages and rising food prices in Nepal prompted thousands of students to protest against a border blockade with India.

display_asset.caption: A reward sign and messages near where Tyshawn Lee was fatally shot in Chicago.

summaries.body: The Chicago police have made an arrest in the death of Tyshawn Lee, a 9-year-old boy who was shot in an alley while on the way to his grandmother's house.

display_asset.caption: Tom Hooper narrates a sequence from “The Danish Girl” featuring Eddie Redmayne and Alicia Vikander.
display_asset.title: Anatomy of a Scene | ‘The Danish Girl’

summaries.body: The director Tom Hooper narrates a sequence from “The Danish Girl,” featuring Eddie Redmayne as Lili Elbe, one of the first people to attempt sex reassignment surgery.
The police say they have arrested a man believed to be the driver who fatally struck a woman in Brooklyn on Thursday, then injured about a dozen people as he fled.
New research suggests that Mars might one day have rings, like Saturn.
Penn State has spent over $92 million in settlements and costs stemming from the sexual abuse scandal tied to Jerry Sandusky, a former football coach.

display_asset.caption: Kissing bugs feed on blood – but there’s no kissing.
display_asset.credit: A.E. Araiza/The Arizona Daily Star, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Despite a sudden surge in news reports, the C.D.C. considers deaths from a parasite that triatomines, or “kissing bugs,” carry to be extremely rare.

display_asset.credit: Chad Batka for The New York Times

summaries.body: A Wu-Tang Clan album that won’t be available for wide release for another 88 years was sold to an unknown bidder for millions, more than an Elvis Presley recording.

display_asset.caption: Is this the real life? Is this just fantasy?

summaries.body: Forget turducken. It’s piecaken time. Continuing the American tradition of stuffing food into other types of food for Thanksgiving.

display_asset.caption: A man wearing a mask associated with the hacking collective Anonymous making a statement a day after the attacks in Paris.

summaries.body: Anonymous hackers have been blocking ISIS recruiting efforts on social media, but the tactics risk penalizing Arab speakers and journalists with no ISIS links, experts say.
Support for Bernie Sanders is low on the campus of Wellesley College, Hillary Rodham Clinton's alma mater. But a small group of students is trying to change that.

display_asset.caption: From left, the Mudd Club owner Steve Mass (in cap), Debbie Harry, Kate Pierson and Richard Boch, the Mudd Club’s longtime doorman.
display_asset.credit: Christian Hansen for The New York Times

summaries.body: A one-night revival of the iconic '80s club, the Mudd Club, reunited clubgoers who remembered the New York City spot as the gritty alternative to Studio 54.

display_asset.caption: Stedman Bailey during a game against the Minnesota Vikings on Nov. 8. He had 12 receptions so far this season.

summaries.body: Stedman Bailey, 25, a receiver for the St. Louis Rams, was in critical condition after he was shot in Florida on Tuesday evening, ESPN reported.
A Belgian court sentenced the comedian Dieudonné M’bala M’bala to two months in prison over anti-Semitic remarks he made during a 2012 show.

display_asset.caption: A woman, who was seen on video, arrived at the Holy Jesus Child Church in Richmond Hill, Queens, on Monday with a newborn, who was left behind in an empty manger scene.

summaries.body: An hours-old baby, his umbilical cord still attached, was left in a Nativity scene at a Queens church. Detectives were trying to speak with a woman seen on video with the child.
